title: Application and Limitation Analysis of the ARCS Motivation Model: Mobile Microlearning Design for Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language learning experience and understanding of fundamental instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: Mobile environment enabling flexible learning for current practitioners with busy schedules. Analysis of ARCS model applications specialized for language education and diagnosis of limitations

learning_goals: Specific strategies can be proposed for applying the four elements of the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) to language education, with at least three examples.
Project-based solutions can be suggested to address the limitations of applying the ARCS model in actual mobile microlearning environments.
Improved approaches to the ARCS model utilizing emerging technologies like VR/AR can be explained through case analysis.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
